Article Title: 'End of my career', 'biometrics done, what to do now': Panic spreads as US defers H-1B visa appointments in India
Article Text:
Trump’s Massive Visa Crackdown: 85,000 Cancellations and Social-Media Scrutiny Hit Indians

'Stuck in India, end of my career'

'Canceled right after I completed biometrics today'





Visa applicants in India Tuesday received messages that their appointment at the consular office this week has been rescheduled . The rescheduled dates are mostly in March 2026 as the immigration office buys time for social media vetting of applicants -- the new rule that kicks in from December 15, 2025 where all social media accounts of applicants will be scrutinized to check if the individual made any negative posts about the US.Panic spread as the US Embassy in India also confirmed that appointment dates are being rescheduled. "If you have received an email advising that your visa appointment has been rescheduled, Mission India looks forward to assisting you on your new appointment date. Arriving on your previously scheduled appointment date will result in your being denied admittance to the Consulate," the message said.Social media users said the clarification from the embassy was vague as applicants are left in a lurch, as they don't know what to do until March, and whether their companies in the US will allow them to remain in India till March.A Redditor said the appointment rescheduling will end the career as the US employer would not allow to work remotely. "I am stuck in India, have biometrics this week. I used all my leaves to come for stamping. My employer cannot allow me to work remotely. This is the end of my career, worked so hard to get a job and build my life so far, everything is gone with one single decision. I dont know what to do since it is moved to May 2025, and I will certainly lose my job.This is the end of all my hardwork and dreams," the person wrote.One user said the visa appointment in Chennai consulated scheduled on December 18 got canceled right after their biometrics Tuesday. "This is new uncharted territory for everyone. I think you and everyone else should reach out to your employer and their immigration firms, solicit their advice and come back to this group with the advice provided by the lawyers. Only after a good sample set of advice received from various employers and lawyers, will we able to make sense of what the next steps can be," one wrote. Some applicants said they came to India for that appointment and now they don't know what to do as they can't stay in India until their rescheduled date in 2026.
Article Summary: Visa applicants in India received messages that their appointment at the consular office this week has been rescheduled. Rescheduled dates are mostly in March 2026 as the immigration office buys time for social media vetting. The new rule kicks in from December 15, 2025 where all social media accounts of applicants will be scrutinized to check if the individual made any negative posts about the US.

Article Title: Aakash Chopra mocks Sahibzada Farhan: 'Jasprit Bumrah ko chhakka maarna itna aasaan nahi hota' - WATCH
Article Text:
Sahibzada Farhan and Jasprit Bumrah (Image credit: Agencies)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Inside a champion’s mind | ft. Shafali, Deepti and Saiyami | TOI’s Ideas for India

NEW DELHI: India started their T20 series against South Africa on a dominating note, thrashing the visitors by 101 runs in the first T20I at Cuttack. Batting first, India posted a competitive 175 for six in 20 overs, with Hardik Pandya ’s blistering 59* off just 28 balls, studded with six fours and four sixes, leading the charge. Tilak Varma (26 off 32) and Axar Patel (23 off 21) also made valuable contributions, while Jitesh Sharma remained unbeaten on 10 off five balls.In reply, South Africa never looked in control and were bowled out for 74 in 12.3 overs. Dewald Brevis offered some resistance with 22 runs, but the Indian bowling unit, led by Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah , Varun Chakravarthy, and Axar Patel, dismantled the opposition, each picking up two wickets. Hardik and Shivam Dube claimed one each. The all-round performance earned Hardik the Player of the Match award, as India took a 1-0 lead in the five-match series.However, more attention than the match itself has been drawn to former India cricketer and commentator Aakash Chopra , who took playful pot shots at Pakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan .During South Africa’s innings, when the team were 28/2 in the fourth over, Bumrah bowled a good-length delivery on the last ball after Aiden Markram had smashed a six.Commentating at the time, Chopra said, “Bumrah ko chhakka maarna itna aasaan nahi hota. Kabhi lag jaaye to kuch log documentary bana lete hain [It’s not so easy to hit Bumrah for a six. If someone manages to do it once, some people even make a documentary on it].”Watch the video here The remark, delivered without naming anyone, clearly referenced Sahibzada Farhan, who had hit Bumrah for sixes during the Asia Cup T20 2025.Farhan had even shared a clip of a documentary made on his innings after Pakistan lost to India in the final, making him a target for Chopra’s humorous dig.The commentary clip has gone viral, with fans praising Chopra’s wit.The second T20I between India and South Africa will be played on December 11 in Mullanpur.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by 101 runs in the first T20I at Cuttack. Hardik Pandya scored 59 off 28 balls, studded with six fours and four sixes. South Africa were bowled out for 74 in 12.3 overs.

Article Title: 'Power of money': MP couple's 'dream' wedding becomes ground for trolls; attacked with racist comments
Article Text: A Madhya Pradesh couple's wedding video became a breeding ground for trolls after it was bombarded with racist and misogynistic comment because of the difference in their skin colour.The couple had been dating for 11 years and got married last month.Images and videos from their vibrant wedding captured the couple taking part in traditional rituals and posing in elaborate attire.However, when they posted these moments on social media, the congratulatory messages were mixed with “jokes and memes,” as trolls mocked and criticised the pair, targeting the groom’s skin tone."People were making jokes and memes and it felt very wrong," BBC quoted the groom Rishabh Rajput saying. "People were making jokes and memes and it felt very wrong. "It was our moment and we had waited for it so many years. It was supposed to be a happy moment, but when I saw people's reactions, I was really shocked," he added.The bride also became a target of online abuse, with several commenters insinuating that she married him “for his money.”"You think - is this is how people are perceiving us? When they say nasty things about him or call me a gold-digger, it irritates me," the bride Sonali Chouksey said.In a post on Instagram later, the groom issued a statement saying: "Sorry to disappoint you. I'm not a government employee, but I work hard for my family and want to give them a good, dignified life.""From college till today, she has stood with me through every good and bad moment. People's negative opinions mean nothing to me," he wrote.
Article Summary: Madhya Pradesh couple's wedding video bombarded with racist and misogynistic comment. Couple had been dating for 11 years and got married last month. The bride also became a target of online abuse, with commenters insinuating that she married him “for his money”

Article Title: Why Sherrone Moore ended up in police custody amid Michigan firing him for alleged ‘inappropriate relationship’ scandal
Article Text:
Sherrone Moore fired and detained later (Getty Images)

What we know about Sherrone Moore’s firing



Sherrone Moore’s swift fall from one of college football’s most respected sidelines has stunned the Michigan community. The former Wolverines head coach, once celebrated for guiding the team through high-pressure moments, now faces a storm of allegations and uncertainty. His dismissal came only hours before police in Saline, Michigan confirmed he had been detained, adding another layer of tension to a day already marked by upheaval.The sudden collapse of Moore’s tenure unfolded at a pace that left players, fans and analysts scrambling for clarity. Accusations of an “inappropriate” relationship with a staffer triggered an internal investigation at the university, and the outcome was severe. While officials have not shared the specifics, the decision to terminate him with cause and hand the matter to law enforcement points to a situation far more serious than anyone inside the program expected.The University of Michigan released a series of statements outlining the reasons behind Moore’s dismissal, though key details remain concealed. “U-M head football coach Sherrone Moore has been terminated, with cause, effective immediately,” the school wrote, adding that “credible evidence was found that Coach Moore engaged in an inappropriate relationship with a staff member.”The university emphasized that “this conduct constitutes a clear violation of University policy, and U-M maintains zero tolerance for such behavior. ”Hours after the firing, the City of Saline Police Department confirmed Moore’s detention. “The City of Saline Police Department assisted in locating and detaining former University of Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore,” the department said. “Mr. Moore was turned over to the Pittsfield Township Police Department for investigation into potential charges.” The nature of the incident that required police action has not been disclosed.With Moore out, Michigan moved quickly to stabilize the program. Veteran assistant and former Charlotte head coach Biff Poggi was appointed interim coach, stepping into the role for the second time this year after previously filling in during Moore’s suspension stemming from the sign-stealing scandal.Moore’s exit closes a chapter that once held enormous promise. Hired in 2018, he climbed through the ranks, helped engineer the team’s championship season in 2023, and made history as Michigan’s first Black full-time head coach. His record stood at 18-8, and he had three years left on a contract worth more than six million dollars for the upcoming season. The firing for cause means the university avoids paying his multi-million-dollar buyout.Michigan now begins its search for a permanent successor at a moment of turmoil, entering an already crowded and fast-moving coaching market with more questions than answers.Also Read: Travis Kelce erupts in expletive-filled rant as Chiefs’ fading playoff hopes push simmering retirement rumors louder
Article Summary: Sherrone Moore was fired with cause by the University of Michigan. He was later detained by police in Saline, Michigan. The school says he had an "inappropriate relationship" with a staff member. He had three years left on a six-million- dollar contract.

Article Title: Sidney Crosby’s future ignites debate after anonymous poll exposes three teams players secretly expect him to play for next
Article Text:
Sidney Crosby’s future (Imagn Images)

Top teams Sidney Crosby could play for next



Hockey fans love a good mystery, and few topics stir more curiosity than Sidney Crosby’s future. A new anonymous poll among NHL players has given that conversation fresh life. The answers reveal a clear theme. While the league changes fast, most players still believe Crosby will choose stability over spectacle. The poll, conducted by The Athletic with 120 participants, asked players where they think Crosby will play next. The responses hint at loyalty, superstition, and admiration that stretch far beyond Pittsburgh.The numbers lean heavily toward one conclusion. Nearly every player believes Crosby is still tied to the city he has called home since his first NHL shift. A non-Penguins player summed it up by saying, "He's been a Penguin for all his career. Riding it out and playing all his years there, that would be a special moment for him." That sentiment echoed again and again, building a picture of a superstar whose identity feels inseparable from his team.Players described Crosby with words that paint him as someone who values routine and long-term bonds. One said, "I think he's a pretty loyal (guy) and seems like a guy who's going to spend his whole career in one place."Another added that even though legends sometimes finish their careers elsewhere, Crosby’s steady nature makes him different. Some pointed to his habits, saying he “seems like a pretty superstitious guy,” which only strengthened their belief that he won’t pack up and move.Others made their opinions even more direct. "I think Crosby is a Pen for life. I can't see him anywhere else." Another added, "I think he's extremely loyal." One more said, «I think he finishes (his career) off in Pittsburgh.» A player even joked about his production with, "And he'll probably score 100 points again. That seems like his going rate." The idea that Pittsburgh would let him go felt unthinkable to some. "They're not going to let him walk. They'd lose too many fans."Still, the poll revealed two other teams that players see as realistic possibilities. Montreal came in second, a nod to Eastern Canadian roots and childhood fandoms. Article Title: Rice University sees growing concern as Claire Tracy’s dark TikTok devil trend chat appears days before her death

Claire Tracy’s final TikTok posts show fear, pain, and deep loneliness



Rice University soccer player Claire Tracy, 19, shared very troubling TikTok posts only days before she was found dead near the Houston campus. Local reports say she was discovered on Sunday at an off-campus apartment complex two blocks from Rice University. Police and the school have not released any official cause of death.As friends and classmates try to understand what happened, people are looking at her TikTok page, which shows her final days. One post shows her taking part in a TikTok game called the “devil trend.” In this trend, she asked someone, a friend or maybe a chatbot, to answer a dark question. Many posts on her page also showed deep sadness, loneliness, and stress.Rice University confirmed her death in an email shared by Dean of Undergraduates Bridget K. Gorman, and her soccer coach and school president also paid emotional tributes. The school said she was a bright student, a kind friend, and a talented athlete from Wisconsin.In one TikTok message, Claire Tracy wrote, “I’m doing ‘the devil’ trend on TikTok.” She explained the game step by step: “I will say ‘the devil couldn’t reach me,’ and you will answer, ‘he did.’Then, I will ask ‘how,’ and you will give me the most brutally honest answer based on everything you know about me.”She also showed the answer she received. It said:“Because you did the work for him. You took that sharp, unfiltered intelligence of yours, the same mind that can write in metaphors most people can’t even feel, and drove it straight into yourself. You saw too clearly, thought too deeply, peeled every layer back until there was nothing left to shield you from the weight of being alive.”This was not the only sad post on her page. In another TikTok video, she said, “I’m going insane at this point and I need to see if anyone else feels like me.”She also wrote that her “depression got so bad” that she started working on an investment banking project just so she “didn’t have to think.”Many of her posts talked about being lonely and struggling with being neurodivergent. She said she had a hard time with simple things like small talk. One day, she recorded herself at the gym on a Friday night and wrote,“When my mom asks why I’m at the gym on a Friday night alone again… my two friends aren’t free again so I’d go mentally insane if I didn’t workout for at least two hours.”Her classmates in Houston have been sharing memories of her since her passing. Local outlets reported that she was found in an apartment complex close to campus. Rice University shared an official message on its website. Dean Bridget K. Gorman wrote,“It is with deep sadness that I am writing to tell you that Claire Tracy, a second-year undergraduate student, passed away on Sunday.”She added that Claire came from Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin, and was a strong student and a loved member of Wiess College.Claire’s soccer coach Brian Lee wrote,“The entire Rice soccer community mourns the loss of Claire Tracy. Our thoughts and prayers go to Claire’s friends and family and to the many current and former teammates, whose lives were impacted by Claire’s kindness. She will forever be in our hearts.”During his yearly address, Rice University President Reggie DesRoches also asked for a moment of silence. He said,“She was deeply connected to many students and known for her Rice spirit.”Her death remains under investigation, and no cause of death has been shared yet.Also Read: Anna Kournikova Vs Enrique Iglesias Net Worth In 2025: Tennis Star And Music Icon Wealth Compared

Article Title: Punjab: Couple wins Rs 1.5-cr lottery, goes into hiding over extortion fears; returns after cop assure safety
Article Text: BATHINDA: A daily-wage family in Faridkot went into hiding after winning a Rs 1.5-crore lottery, fearing extortion threats. The family locked their house, switched off their phones, and went into hiding. It was only after a police team visited them and reassured their safety that they gained the confidence to return home.Nasib Kaur, a daily wager from Saideke village, had won the top prize in the Punjab State Lottery, but the sudden windfall left the family more frightened than jubilant.The couple did not immediately know that luck favoured them. A lottery seller from the nearby town of Sadiq discovered that the Rs 200 ticket bought by Nasib Kaur had won the first prize on Dec 6 and repeatedly called her husband, Ram Singh, who didn't answer the calls, as he was in Rajasthan.Once the family was traced, the lottery seller accompanied them to Chandigarh to submit the winning ticket.Ram Singh had been buying lottery tickets for nearly two years, and this time he decided to try his luck with a costlier Rs 200 ticket. The family turned out to be the winner of the first prize of Rs 1.5 crore, said lottery seller Raju.Their family includes three daughters, all married, and an unmarried son.Worried that the money might attract extortionists, the family members left home for an undisclosed place but returned home on Wednesday.Faridkot deputy superintendent of police (DSP) Tarlochan Singh said the police are committed to the safety of everyone, and a team visited the family, who won the lottery and returned home.
Article Summary: Nasib Kaur, a daily wager from Saideke village, won the top prize in the Punjab State Lottery. The family locked their house, switched off their phones, and went into hiding. It was only after a police team visited them and reassured their safety that they gained the confidence to return home.

Article Title: Bhopal mortuary case: Burnt bodies of 2 newborns found in garbage; police launch probe
Article Text: BHOPAL: Panic spread in the area surrounding the Gandhi Medical College/Hamidia Hospital mortuary on Wednesday after two newborns were allegedly found burned in a heap of garbage.The incident came to light when waste—dumped and set on fire in an empty plot next to the mortuary—was extinguished, revealing the charred remains of the infants.According to Koh-e-Fiza Police ASI Zafar-ul-Hasan, hospital workers and visitors often dump garbage in the open ground beside a fountain near the mortuary. Flames were seen rising from the garbage mound in the early hours of Wednesday, prompting hospital staff and authorities to take immediate action, and they doused the fire.In the morning, passersby noticed what appeared to be the burned remains of infants amid the charred waste. Koh-e-Fiza police were informed, and a team retrieved the remains around 1 pm. One of the newborns was burned nearly 90 percent, while the second was partially charred.Police said the infants were wrapped in plastic before being dumped. Burnt plastic was found stuck to their bodies, suggesting they were placed inside a plastic sheet or bag before the fire.A bedsheet was also found in the garbage, leading police to suspect the babies were wrapped in it before being discarded.Police are now working to determine whether the newborns were already dead when dumped or were burned alive. Post-mortem examinations will establish the cause and timing of death. Police have also requested DNA sampling to investigate possible links to recent deliveries or abandoned infants.CCTV cameras installed around the mortuary failed to provide helpful footage due to poor quality, hampering immediate identification of suspects. Both remains have been preserved in the mortuary for post-mortem, and a detailed probe is underway.
Article Summary: Two newborns were allegedly found burned in a heap of garbage. The incident came to light when waste was set on fire in an empty plot next to the mortuary. One of the newborns was burned nearly 90 percent, while the second was partially charred. Police said the infants were wrapped in plastic before being dumped.

Article Title: ‘I bet I’m the first’: Singer Jelly Roll breaks down as Craig Morgan surprises him with Opry invite on Rogan podcast — watch
Article Text: An unexpected invitation left American singer and rapper Jelly Roll in tears during an interview with the podcaster Joe Rogan.Joe Rogan, in his show, surprised the singer with a video message from singer-songwriter Craig Morgan, inviting Roll to be the official member of the Opry.In the video message, Morgan recalled their first meeting at the Opry and said, "I need to say congratulations on all the great things happening in your career and to thank you for the positive difference you're making in the lives of so many people who need the help. You're doing great work, buddy. And I'll never forget meeting you on the Grand Ole Opry and how much it meant to me to hear you say my music helped you get through some really tough times. That's one thing country music does really well.""And who would have ever dreamed back then that I'd be back at the Opry house today to say, jelly Roll, you're officially invited to become a member of the Grand Ole Opry. It's an honor to say welcome to the family, brother," he added.After hearing the invitation, the singer broke down in tears and spoke about his relationship with Morgan and seeing him perform live for the first time at the Opry while still wearing an ankle monitor following his release from prison.But excitement soon took over as the reality of the honour sank in. “I bet I’m the first person to ever get invited to the Grand Ole Opry on a podcast!” he exclaimed.On Instagram, Jelly Roll wrote alongside a clip of the interview, “I’m honored beyond words and I can’t stop pinching myself. To everyone at the Opry, y’all are like family to me. Manchester City delivered a dramatic comeback to beat Real Madrid 2-1 at the Santiago Bernabeu on Wednesday, a result that has pushed Xabi Alonso closer to the brink amid growing uncertainty over his future. Despite taking an early lead, Madrid’s frailties resurfaced and Pep Guardiola’s side capitalised, leaving the Spanish giants facing both a Champions League struggle and a coaching dilemma.Madrid, missing injured superstar Kylian Mbappe, began brightly and struck first through Rodrygo Goes, who ended a draining 33-game goal drought. The Brazilian finished a flowing counter-attack initiated by Alvaro Carreras, drilling low past Gianluigi Donnarumma after being played through by Jude Bellingham. Rodrygo’s celebration — embracing Alonso on the touchline — was a pointed show of support during what he later called “a difficult moment” for the squad and its manager.But the momentum flipped abruptly. City equalised in the 35th minute after Thibaut Courtois spilled Josko Gvardiol’s header, allowing Nico O’Reilly to pounce and tap home. The error punctured Madrid’s early rhythm, and frustration inside the Bernabeu grew as whistles rang out during a disjointed second half.City then struck again just before halftime. Antonio Rudiger hauled Erling Haaland to the ground inside the box, and the Norwegian made no mistake from the spot, sending Courtois the wrong way to give City a 2-1 lead they would protect until the end.Madrid continued to press for an equaliser but produced few clear openings. Courtois redeemed himself with sharp stops to deny Haaland, Rayan Cherki, and later Jeremy Doku, but the hosts lacked creativity and conviction. Alonso introduced 19-year-old Endrick late on, and the youngster nearly rescued a point when his effort clipped the crossbar with minutes remaining.Spanish media had widely reported that defeat would all but seal Alonso’s dismissal, and the atmosphere reflected those stakes. Madrid have now won just two of their last eight matches across competitions, slipping dangerously in the Champions League league-phase standings.Guardiola admitted City were second-best early on but praised his side’s resilience: “Until the goal we scored, they were much better.”Defender Raul Asencio insisted the dressing room remains behind Alonso, but with President Florentino Perez monitoring closely, Madrid could be headed for yet another change in the dugout.

The Indianapolis Colts have shocked the NFL by pulling 44-year-old Philip Rivers out of retirement after Daniel Jones went down with a season-ending Achilles injury. With the playoff race tightening and stability at quarterback slipping away, the Colts turned to a trusted veteran who already proved he can win in Indianapolis. Suddenly, Rivers is back in the building and potentially days away from returning to action.The biggest question heading into Week 15 is whether the former Pro Bowler will suit up against the Seattle Seahawks. Making a comeback at this stage of the season is rare, but the Colts’ situation might demand it. With a playoff berth still within reach, Indianapolis is evaluating just how quickly Rivers can get up to game speed.Rivers completed a private workout shortly after the Colts’ Week 14 loss to the Jacksonville Jaguars, and the front office liked what they saw. Impressed by his conditioning and familiarity with the system, the team signed him to the practice squad on Tuesday. Now, all attention turns toward how ready he is to take the field and whether he could start as soon as Sunday.As the team ramps up preparations for the Seahawks, the Colts continue to monitor everything from Rivers’ timing to his ability to re-adjust to NFL tempo.While nothing has been finalized, Indianapolis has made it clear they won’t hesitate to activate him if he proves capable of running the offense.Adding to the nostalgia of his return, Rivers will also reclaim his old jersey number. With Daniel Jones on injured reserve, the veteran quarterback will once again wear No. 17, the number he’s proudly represented throughout his entire career.Rivers’ history with Indianapolis gives him a strong head start. During his 2020 season with the Colts, he delivered steady and efficient play, completing 68% of his passes for 4,169 yards, 24 touchdowns, and 11 interceptions. That performance propelled the team to an 11-5 finish and a playoff berth, ending in a narrow Wild Card loss to the Buffalo Bills before Rivers announced his retirement.Now, nearly five years later, Indianapolis is hoping his leadership and precision can once again bring stability at the most crucial point of the season.
